tbb_hash Class

Summary

CAUTION

This feature is deprecated and will be removed in the future.

Hash support class to use with associative containers provided by Intel® Threading Building Blocks (Intel® TBB).

Syntax

template<typename Key> struct tbb_hash;

Description

A tbb_hash<Key> is the default for the Hasher argument of template classes concurrent_unordered_[multi]map, concurrent_unordered_[multi]set. The built-in definitions rely on operator== and tbb_hasher as shown in the Members description. For your own types, you can define template specializations of tbb_hash, or define an overload of tbb_hasher.

There are built-in definitions of tbb_hasher for the following Key types:

  • Types that are convertible to a size_t by static_cast<T>

  • Pointer types

  • std::basic_string

  • std::pair<K1,K2> where K1 and K2 are hashed using tbb_hasher.

Members

namespace tbb {
    template<typename T> 
    size_t tbb_hasher(const T&);

    template<typename T> 
    size_t tbb_hasher(T*);

    template<typename T, typename Traits, typename Alloc>
    size_t tbb_hasher(const std::basic_string<T, Traits,Alloc>&);

    template<typename T1, typename T2>
    size_t tbb_hasher(const std::pair<T1,T2>& );

    template<typename Key>
    struct tbb_hash {
        tbb_hash() {}
        size_t operator()(const Key& k) const {
            return tbb_hasher(k);
        }
    };
}
